title: Historical Revenue Growth Trends of Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc

content.text: In 2016, Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc reported revenue of $3.53 billion, which increased to $4.03 billion in 2017, representing a growth rate of approximately 14.14%.
From 2017 to 2018, the company continued its upward revenue growth trajectory. The revenue increased from $4.03 billion to $4.45 billion, marking a growth rate of approximately 10.42%.
Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc experienced a moderate growth rate in revenue from 2018 to 2019. Revenue went up from $4.45 billion to $4.49 billion, indicating a growth rate of approximately 0.90%.
In 2019, the revenue of Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc slightly declined to $4.48 billion from the previous year's $4.49 billion, resulting in a negative growth rate of approximately -0.22%.
From 2020 to 2021, there was a significant increase in revenue for Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc. Revenue surged from $4.48 billion to $4.98 billion, reflecting a growth rate of approximately 11.16%.

The historical revenue growth trends of Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc demonstrate a generally positive trajectory. While there have been minor fluctuations in certain years, overall, the company has experienced steady revenue growth. This suggests a potential for continued growth and stability for investors in the company. It is important for investors to consider other factors, such as profitability, market conditions, and competitive landscape, before making investment decisions.

news.headline: Avocado goldrush links US companies with Mexico's deforestation disaster
news.summary: On a sweltering July afternoon, two large yellow bulldozers dug into the brown soil at the bottom of a lush avocado orchard near the small town of Madero, located in central Mexico's Michoacan state.  Drone footage recorded by Reuters captured the earth movers hollowing the ground, in what Mexican environmental group Guardian Forestal - which collaborates with the Michoacan state government - and an activist who reviewed the video described as an attempt to construct a water reservoir.  Data from the national water authority Conagua showed only 42 reservoirs and wells in Madero were registered with permits.

news.headline: Fresh Del Monte Produce (NYSE:FDP) Misses Q2 Sales Targets
news.summary: Fresh produce company Fresh Del Monte (NYSE:FDP) missed analysts' expectations in Q2 CY2024, with revenue down 3.5% year on year to $1.14 billion. It made a non-GAAP profit of $1.06 per share, improving from its profit of $0.96 per share in the same quarter last year.
